alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cochise County through 1000 PM MST... At 914 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Bisbee-Douglas Airport, or 17 miles northeast of Douglas, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bisbee-Douglas Airport and McNeal. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 374 and 409. Route 191 between mile markers 5 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
